intro: Lamanonia ternata, commonly known as the three-lobed lamanonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with three distinct lobes and produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant in some regions.
